reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay
reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa right across from the Faldo practice facility. The weather was on the coolish side so we did not use the pool (which looked quite nice). We golfed on the Pines Course .. I think the rate was $129 weekends and $60 after 3 pm. The villa was nice .. the gas fireplace that went on with the flick of a switch was a nice touch. The master bath did have mold on the celling in the corner. But everything else was spotless. I thought the beds were very comfortable. We were not there in the summer and our little screened in dining area outside was dirty, but it didn't matter because it was too cold to be sitting out there. We enjoyed Atlantic City (about 15 minutes away) and also the little shopping village at Smithville (about 5 minutes away). If you have a day (or even a 1/2 day) take a ride to Cape May. This seaside town has gingerbread victorian houses that are amazing. Lots of shops and restaurants. The ride took us about 45 minutes. Not sure I'd return to this resort because it was a long drive from Boston (5 1/2 hours), but I'm glad we went there. Like one of the other posters, we had a 1st floor suite and could hear the people above us walking around. I don't think it is very soundproof.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Villas are very nice, new and large. However, the room we stayed in had hair in the bath tub and on the toilet upon our arrival. It was promptly cleaned when reported. Our buffet breakfast cost $48 including tip, excessive in my opinion, and the potatoes had Hair in them. My wife was disgusted. Our complimentary round of golf actually cost us over $50 because we were forced to rent a cart. So much for the exercize we were looking foreward to. The Bay golf course was very flat and unchallenging, even for my wife and I, who are not the best golfers. This course also has lots of grass fungus as well as crabgrass. Not something I expected from a place that demands $130 per round for golf. The greenhead flies are terrible, as you would expect, being so close to the swampy areas. Which brings me to my last comment: The smell of the swampy water was unbarable for my wife, for me....it smelled, but I am used to the Jersey shore's smell.
reviews.title: Hair, hair everywhere

likes.disliked: — Not well kept, considering the cost

reviews.text: I would not return to this facility.
reviews.title: Wonderful Anniversary Getaway!

reviews.text: Where do I begin? Since I'm a travel agent, I got a great deal on this location at a travel show - 4 days/3 nights for $99. Can't beat that. I got this package back in October. My anniversary is May 30th. It was a Tuesday this year, so I booked our stay for Sunday, May 28th - Wednesday, May 31st. I didn't tell my husband that I booked it. It was a total surprise for him. Since it was Memorial Day weekend, I told him that we were going to a cookout at a friend's house that lives in Jersey. I hadn't told my daughter about the trip b/c I knew she'd spill the beans. Halfway through the drive she says "Mom how long until we get to the hotel?" I ignored her and so did my husband. Then 15 mins later, she asked again - so I had to tell him what the plans were. I had him scheduled to be off from work, and had packed bags for the 3 of use earlier that day (he was out running around).
reviews.title: Great two bedroom villas right by Atlantic City

reviews.text: The directions were perfect. When we checked in, the staff was very upbeat and happy to see us. They explained everything about the property and our villa. They asked if we wanted to be closer to the pool or to golf - my daughter picked the pool. Since I had seen the reveiews here, I knew what to expect. When my husband and daughter walked in, they were VERY excited and pleased. The bathrooms were a nice size and having 2 sinks in each was perfect. My daughter loved that in her room there was a sofa (a pullout) also. My husband was more than pleased with the jacuzzi in our room and the seperate shower and "waterhole" :-) The fireplace is a great addition if you're visiting in the Winter. It's a gas fireplace and I could tell it warms up the room quickly. There is also a small screened in porch with a table and chairs.
reviews.title: A Fabulous Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is for the Marriott Vacation Villas at Seaview:
reviews.title: Believe the Good Reviews!

likes.liked: — Lovely setting, privacy, adequate parking, spa, golf

reviews.text: THE GOOD:
reviews.title: Good Getaway
wonderful wintertime family getaway
reviews.text: Spacious, apartment-like rooms - nicely appointed
Screened porches - delightful
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large kitchens with modern appliances - very clean
reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more!

likes.disliked: — Wished it was closer to the beach

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Fairway Villas with my brother and sister-in-law for a couples getaway weekend. The villas were perfect for us. Huge kitchen, dining area, living room and two nice bedrooms and baths. The kitchen was stocked with every type of dish, pot, pan and appliance you could need. Nice laundry area with washer and dryer. Screened in outdoor patio. Nice, functional furnishings. Everything was spotlessly clean and well maintained. Particularly perfect for an extended stay with small children. Even the price was reasonable for mid-summer.
reviews.title: Great villas, Great Spa.....Horrible Food!

reviews.text: The facilities were exceptionally nice. Large indoor and outdoor pool areas with convenience store and food service. They also had a "serenity" saltwater pool for adults only which was very nice and relaxing. Nice design with beautiful landscaping, large, clean whirlpool with waterfall and even large fans poolside to keep you cool. Two golf courses and golf school. None of us play, but we wish we did afer staying here. Playground, nice public areas and acres and acres of beautiful, well maintained grounds.
reviews.title: Just returned from the Marriott

reviews.text: The highlight of our stay was the Elizabeth Arden Red Door Spa. My sister-in-law and I spent a lot of time there. It is a large, luxurious facility with every possible amenity but completely unpretentious and comfortable. They offer a myriad of services and treatments. The place is so big that they were able to book us at a moment's notice, eventhough they were in the middle of their busiest season. We had facials, waxing, manicures and pedicures, and although everything was rather pricey, we were completely satisfied with the services and experience. Moreso than with even some of the big name salons and spas in Philly and NYC.
reviews.title: Loved it! (and we don't golf!)
Family loved it !
reviews.text: The big disappointment of our stay was the food. We made the mistake of going to the dining room at the main hotel for dinner on Saturday night. The hotel is lovely and classic old world Jersey shore. Very charming. We arrived at the large dining room around 7:30 to find it 3/4 empty. Although we didn't have a reservation, we thought they would easily be able to accomodate us given the large number of empty tables. We had a glance at the menu which looked very tempting, although pricey, and decided to treat ourselves to a nice dinner. When we asked to be seated, the host and hostess looked at us like we were crazy when we told them we didn't have a reservation. It then required 20 mins. of various discussions with members of the waitstaff, much gesticulating and many annoyed glances in our direction before we were seated. We were all a little taken aback by this attitude, but our waitress was friendly enough so we decided to let it go and not let it spoil the evening.

All four of us ordered appetizers, salads and expensive entrees, everything from lobster bisque to surf and turf. We were uniformly disappointed by each and every dish. The pasta was mushy, my husband's lobster bisque was a disgusting brown color and absolutely inedible, my sister-in-law's $48 lobster tails were small, dry and cold, even the salads were just bland and bad. The service was so impossibly slow that, by the time we got to our entrees almost two hours after being seated, we weren't even hungry anymore. It took another hour for us to get our $300 check, not including alcohol, coffee or dessert because we just couldn't stand to sit there any longer. By the way, the restaurant remained more than 3/4 empty the whole time we were there.
reviews.title: This is nice resort hotel!!!
Loved the Fariway Villa's
reviews.text: The place was awesome and the Golfing wonderful. You are only 10 minutes from Atlantic City if you like gambling and site seeing. their adult only mineral pool was incredible as well as their spa. the condo's were new and very quiet. I would rate it a 10 out of 10!!

reviews.title: Renting as a Hotel isn't the same as exchanging
reviews.text: Renting a 2 bed 2 bath unit is not the same as asking a Timeshare Exchange company (like Interval International) for an exchange. They attempt to treat an exchange as a like for like. Seaview is a 5 star unit with red weeks most of the year. An exchange MIGHT be possible if your unit matched those at Seaview.

reviews.title: Great time
reviews.text: We stayed at fairways at seaview from April 9th-April 16th. The resort is very nice. The area is beautiful. There is a wide range of things to do from gambling to the family friendly broadwalk in Ocean City. It rained most of our days there many of our plans were spoiled. The kids enjoyed the indoor pool. My husband and I visited the Red Door spa. I think I'm hooked. The children's activities at the resort were pretty basic. However, my children did enjoy them. We were impressed w/the Easter day events. The villas provide plenty of room for a family. The villas were very nice w/a screen balcony, fireplace, whirlpool, a full kitchen and 2 bedroom. We will never stay in a regular hotel room again. I would have liked to purchased a week there but we already own a week elsewhere.

reviews.title: Timeshare Villas reservations are never available when we want them
reviews.text: The timeshare Villas seem to never be available when we try to book them. As a timeshare, the units are nice, but I would rate the availability as terrible.

reviews.title: We loved it!
reviews.text: We were plesantly surprised with this resort. We had a 2 BR villa with a fireplace, whirlpool bath, screened in patio and full kitchen with washer and dryer. It was furnished beautifully as well as comfortably. It was right on the golf course and next door to the Seaview Resort. On propert was an Elizabeth Red Door Spa which offered massages, manicures, spa treatments etc. That is also where the indoor pool was located. Aside from being close to Atlantic City we found so many things to do in the area. We went to Historic Smithville which was a quaint little shopping village with a carousel, train ride, live theater,geese you could feed, ponds etc. We also went to Cape May which was less than an hours drive away. We spent an entire day there. We also drove down there another day and took the ferry to Delaware for shopping and exploring.
